info.description:
The Activity Service API is a web service that provides access to a range
of activities for users. It's primarily designed to allow users to search,
view, book, and cancel activities in an efficient and user-friendly manner.

Here are the key functionalities of the API:

1. **Get List of Activities**: This endpoint returns a list of all
   available activities. Each activity comes with basic information
   like name and description.
2. **Get Activity Description**: This endpoint provides a detailed
   description of a specific activity. It requires the ID of the activity
  as input.
3. **Check Activity Availability**: This feature is integrated within the
   activity description endpoint. Along with the description, it also shows
   the current availability status of the activity.
4. **Book an Activity**: This endpoint allows users to book a specific
   activity. It requires the ID of the activity and user details for
   successful booking.
5. **Cancel Booking**: This endpoint allows users to cancel their booking
   for a specific activity. It requires the ID of the booking to perform
   the cancellation.

This API is designed to be RESTful, using standard HTTP methods like
GET, POST, and DELETE, and it primarily exchanges data in JSON format.

### Change History

| API Version | Docs Version | Changes                                                                                                                                      |
|-------------|--------------|----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| 1.0         | 31.05.2023   | Initial version                                                                                                                              |

### Authentication
All API requests must be made over HTTPS.
info.title: Connect API for Activities

tags.description:
This API uses POST instead of GET for some read operations.
This is due to the complexity and size of some queries.

In HTTP/1.1, GET is typically used for data retrieval. It
should be safe and idempotent, causing no side effects.
However, GET has limitations with complex queries or
large data. For instance, some servers or browsers limit
the maximum URL length for GET requests.

POST requests carry their data in the body of the request.
This allows for larger and more complex data to be sent.
This is useful when the data volume or complexity of
query parameters exceeds GET limitations.

In this API, POST is used for some read operations to
overcome these GET limitations. This allows handling
of complex queries and large data effectively,
ensuring reliable and efficient API operation.
tags.name: Offers

get.description:
This endpoint, often known as a "health check" endpoint, is used for
monitoring and assessing the status of the service. Its main function
is to signal the health of the service, aiding in identifying any
potential issues or service breakdowns.

TripBuilder will periodically call this endpoint to check the
service's status. The response from this health check endpoint is used
to assess the current condition of the service. If the service is
operating correctly, the endpoint will return a positive
acknowledgment, i.e. a HTTP 200 status code and a message indicating
the service's health.

On the other hand, if the service is not functioning as expected, the
endpoint will return an error status code and potentially additional
data about the issue's nature.

This proactive health check allows for prompt detection and
resolution of issues, ensuring the service's reliability and smooth
functioning.

post.description:
This endpoint allows a user to authenticate before making any request.
Upon successful authentication, the endpoint returns a JSON
response with the bearer token. In case of an error, a default error
response is returned.

This endpoint allows users to search for bookable activities in the specified period.
We expect a single offer for each activity, preferably a basic category offer for an adult.
A separate call to a different endpoint will fetch the details, including all offers, of the activity.
The reference of the offer. This value is returned by ActivityOffer message.

parameters.description: The reference of the offer. This value is returned by ActivityOffer message.
parameters.name: reference

post.summary: Get the detail of an activity offer

parameters.description: Optional. the sub-items of the booking so that the cancellation can be done
parameters.name: itemsIds

post.description:
This endpoint allows a user to book an activity using various parameters.
Upon successful booking, the endpoint returns a JSON
response with booking details. In case of an error, a default error
response is returned.

parameters.description: The reference of the offer. This value is returned by ActivityOffer message.
parameters.name: reference

post.summary: Check availability of an activity offer

get.description:
Fetch a list of already booked activities for the given booking that
can be pulled from the provider.

parameters.description: Generic ID of the booking in system. A single booking may contain more than one activity/tickets booked.
parameters.name: bookingId

parameters.description: The desired language in the response (2 letter code)
parameters.name: lang

parameters.description: The desired currency in the response (3 letter code)
parameters.name: currency

get.summary: Fetch a list of already booked activities

get.description: Fetch details of an already booked activities from the provider.

parameters.description: Generic ID of the booking in system. A single booking may contain more than one activity/tickets booked.
parameters.name: bookingId

parameters.description: The desired language in the response (2 letter code)
parameters.name: lang

parameters.description: The desired currency in the response (3 letter code)
parameters.name: currency

parameters.description: Specific IDs of the activities in the booking. It is expected that exactly one activity will match every ID.
parameters.name: activityIds

LoginResponse.description:
Returns the bearer token upon successful authentication or a list of notifications.
The expiration value in the authentication response is useful to keep accurate track of when a token will expire.

expiresInMinutes.description: The expiration of the token in minutes

LoginResponse.title: Represents authentication response

total.description:
Total number of results
Can be ignored in requests, the response always give back this information

pageSize.description:
Number of results per page
If the parameter is not specified, the pageSize is the total number of results

resultsFrom.description:
Position (zero based) of the first result to retrieve
If the parameter is not specified, the value is 0

startDate.description: Desired starting date of the product represented in ISO8601 format (yyyy-MM-dd)

startTime.description:
Desired starting zoned date/time of the product in ISO8601 format (HH:mm:ss.SSS).
Empty if the activity doesn't have a specific start time (e.g. full day).

endDate.description:
Desired ending date of the product represented in ISO8601 format (yyyy-MM-dd)
Empty if the activity doesn't have a specific end time (e.g. full day).

endTime.description: Desired ending zoned date/time of the product in ISO8601 format (HH:mm:ss.SSS).

nights.description: Duration in nights of the product

GeoLocation.description: The location can be represented in one of the following types (geoCircle, geoPolygon or destinationId)
GeoLocation.title: Representation of an area

radius.title: radius in meter around the center

GeoPolygon.title: Area defined by a set of points

age.description: age of the pax at the beginning of the TravelPeriod

nationality.description: 2 letters code of the country (ISO 3166-1 alpha-2)

nezasaRefId.description: an optional identifier of the pax used for correlation

supplierRefId.description: an optional supplier identifier of the pax

isMainContact.description: if this pax is the main contact

birthDate.description: This date is parsed / serialized through DateTimeFormatter.ISO_LOCAL_DATE
birthDate.title: The birth date of the pax

secondOrAdditionalNames.description: additional names beside first and last names

GeoAddress.description: Basic representation of a physical address.

street2.description: street address, second line if needed

countryCode.description: 2 letters code of the country (ISO 3166-1 alpha-2)

ContactElectronicContactDetails.description: Electronic contacts like phone, email, and website

ContactPhone.description: Phone contact like mobile, landline, fax

CommonPaxTitle.description:
- MR: Mister
- MRS: Mistress or Missus
- MS: Miss
- MSTR: Master, typically used for young boys
- DR: Doctor
- PROF: Professor
- REV: Reverend
- CAPT: Captain
- SIR: Sir
- LADY: Lady
- INF: Infant (0-2 years old)
- CHD: Child (2-11 years old)
CommonPaxTitle.title: The title of pax

ActivityOfferResponse.description:
Generic response providing a list of activity offers.

Returns either a list of activities, or a list of notifications.

ActivityOfferDetailsResponse.description:
Detailed offer response providing an activity offer detail.

Returns either an activity, or a list of notifications.
It also returns a list of questions that need to be answered when
doing the booking.

serviceCategoryReferences.description: The reference(s) of the service category (could represent many tickets for the same activity)

activityLanguage.description: Optional value for the language selected of the activity

ActivityBookingBookResponse.description:
Returns either a booking or a list of notifications.

Optionally a list of "itemIds" can be returned. These represent sub-items
of the booking if the supplier needs them. These will have to be used in
the CancellationRequest so that they can be sent to the supplier.

bookingId.description: the booking identifier. Used to cancel the booking.

itemsIds.description: optional. the sub-items of the booking

ActivityBookingCancellationResponse.description: Returns list of notifications in case of error
ActivityBookingCancellationResponse.title: Represents cancellation response

ActivityBookingAvailabilityCheckResponse.description:
Returns either an availability status and activity offer, or a list of notifications.
The returned activity offer can contain an updated price.
It might also returns a list of extra questions that need to be answered when doing the booking.

ActivityOffer.description:
Representation of a activity offer.
The `reference` is the activity offer identifier and should be as stable as possible (i.e two identical request should return offers with the same references).
Furthermore the reference should be also valid until the activity takes place, so that a book can be made a long time after the planning was done.

description.knowBeforeGo: Be sure to bring a swimsuit, towel, sunscreen, and a sense of adventure.

onRequest.description: If the booking is on request

dropOffs.description: The available list of drop-off points for this activity

description.description: Description of the activity. Supports basic HTML.

countryCode.title: the country code of the activity

pictureItem.description: the picture renditions associated with this picture

ActivityPictureItem.description: A picture item is a picture and describes metadata information of an image file.

ActivityCancellationPolicy.description:
Base the cancellation calculation on the period->startDate.
For instance, if an activity incurs a cancellation fee starting 24
hours before the period->startDate date, then determine the applicable
cancellation fee using the formula: period->startDate minus 24 hours.
ActivityCancellationPolicy.title: The cancellation policy of the activity huhu.

ActivityCancellationPolicyRule.description: A cancellation policy rule. startDatetime and endDatetime define an interval (can be open ended) where this rule applies.

startDatetime.description: The start date time of the cancellation policy rule in ISO8601 format (yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ss.SSS)

endDatetime.description: The end date time of the cancellation policy rule in ISO8601 format (yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ss.SSS).

ActivityServiceCategory.description:
A Service Category describes variations of an activity, usually also with a
variation in price (think normal ticket vs VIP ticket),
schedule (normal activity starts at 9AM, VIP activity starts at 10AM).

You can also represent a more complex hierarchy using name and sub_name
(e.g. 1 -> name = adult, sub_name = half day; 2 -> name = adult,
sub_name = full day; 3 -> name = child, sub_name = full day)

The netPrice is required, the salesPrice is optional. If ommitted,
additional price calculations may be applied. Otherwise, the sales
price will be used unchanged.

id.description: the identifier/reference of this service category

name.description: the name of this service category

subName.title: optional subName of the service category

ActivityPickUpDropOffType.description:
- Unavailable: no pickup/dropoff is available
- Optional: pickup/dropoff is optional
- Required: pickup/dropoff is required. See method GetActivitiesOfferPickUpsDropOffs
ActivityPickUpDropOffType.title: The type of pickup/dropoff information

name.description: The id of the question. will be used to correlate it to an answer

PickUpDropOff.title: Describes the pick up or drop off point of an activity

answerOptions.description: Optional possible answers to this question

ContactElectronicContactDetails_1.description: Electronic contacts like phone, email, and website

ActivityBookingBookStatus.description:
- Unknown: Unknown. most likely an error happened
- Requested: Requested. the booking is "on request"
- Confirmed: Confirmed.
ActivityBookingBookStatus.title: Represents booking status

value.description: The value of the price, e.g. "230.20", "13000.55"

CommonBookingAvailabilityStatus.description:
- Unknown: Unknown. most likely an error happened
- Available: Available
- NotAvailable: Not available. the offer cannot be booked
CommonBookingAvailabilityStatus.title: Represents availability check status

NezasaComponentSourceType.description:
Type of contract used to source the product.

 - Private: Indicates a private contract. The B2B customer sourced the
   component from an external source through his own contract, or sourced
   the component from the Nezasa inventory, which by definition is private.
 - Reseller: Indicates a reseller contract. The B2B customer sourced
   the component from an external source through a Nezasa reseller
   contract.

CommonCancellationPolicy.description:
Defines the cancellation policy type of a product.
 - Free: The cancellation is free for some time after the booking.
 - FeeApplies: There will be some cancellation fee regardless of when the booking is cancelled.
 - NonRefundable: The cancellation fee is 100% once the offer is booked.

description.description: Content of the section. Supports basic HTML.
